turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Come on...Even I'm not that hard on myself.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, I really got this job on a fluke and wait till you hear where it ends up.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I was doing sports at the station. The newspaper ran this untrue story that I was leaving and they got all these tons of protest mail.  So they made me anchor.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: So great -- right?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Except I'm no good at what I'm being a success at.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: How are you at back rubs?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Listen to me.  You keep on thinking I'm somebody ho lacks...confidence. That's not it.  I know I can talk well enough and I'm not bad at making contact with people, but I don't like the feeling that I'm pretending to be a reporter.  And half the time I don't really get the news I'm talking about.  It isn't that I'm down on myself.  Trust me, I stink.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I trust you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I didn't even have the chance to get really good at sports.  I wasn't bad. I thought I was starting to do interesting features but hockey is big at the station and...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: What about the obvious remedy? Reversing things.  Maybe getting a job on a newspaper.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I don't write.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: But that didn't stop me from sending out audition tapes to bigger stations and the networks.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, come on -- it is your life. Nobody is tying you to the fast track.  Did you go to college?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: One year...almost one year.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: So, you're not well educated and you have almost no experience and you can't write.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's hard for me to advise you since you personify something that I truly think is dangerous.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I agree with you -- you're not qualified.  So get qualified.  You can insist on being better prepared.  You don't have to just leave it as...  'I don't write.  I'm not schooled. I don't understand the news I'm reading. But at least I'm upset about it, folks.'

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Whoa, this was a mistake.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Just what do you want from me, anyway? Permission to be a fake?  Stop whining and do something about it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I never told you the reason I was telling you everything for.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hey?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Those audition tapes I sent out... I've been hired by your network for the Washington bureau.  So I'll probably see you at work.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They said it would be okay if...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: We're working here!!  You can stand over in the uh, uh, uh...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm sorry if I was in the way.  It was totally impressive.  Great piece.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You weren't.  Thanks.  How does it feel being here?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I can't believe I'm really here.  No kidding.  If you're through work now --

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: No.  Aaron and I go to Central America on Wednesday -- so I'm cramming.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I thought you were incredible in there. I know how much I have to learn.  I'd really -- a lot -- appreciate it...if...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: 'Really a lot appreciate it...'

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You  make me nervous.  Anyway if I can pick your brain --

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I can't help you, sorry.  I'm not here to teach remedial reporting.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: And it has nothing to do with the fact I left your room instead of staying there?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Can I buy you dinner sometime soon?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I just got back -- I don't know which end is up.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: So he was indicted?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Give it to him -- so we can concentrate.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Ah, I don't want any credit.  Bobbie and I serve anonymously.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I've got another story.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Some public official skipped a week on his Christmas Club?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: The House Armed Service Committee has a secret report which says that the General Stillwell tank the Army has dumped a fortune into plain won't work.  I have it cold, confirmed.  They have five million dollars in this thing already.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Billion.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay, billion...right, of course. They told me I could have any producer I wanted -- and I want you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's the firs time I've seen you dressed like this.  You look so clean and pretty.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: What do you mean clean?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: At work there's always this sort of film over you.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, thumps like me leave appearance to guys like you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're great at taking the edge off a good time.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yes.  Just don't say anything mean for a while.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Excited.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: We're going to George.  Say 'the Joint Chiefs are meeting -- we have George Weln at the Pentagon'.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: George Weln is at the Pentagon where the attack launched by the lone Libyan pilot has resulted in a massive movement of military might.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're an amazing woman.  What a feeling having you inside my head.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yeah.  It was an unusual place to be.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Indescribable -- you knew just when to feed me the next thing, just a split second before I needed it.  There was a rhythm we got into, like great sex.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You have to celebrate with me, don't you?  Everybody's going to that bar on the corner, 'Caps.'

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'm going over to Aaron's.  Maybe I'll hoop up with all of you later.  How long do you think you'll be there?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Jane?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'll wait for you till seven.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I didn't think you'd make it.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, I thought I'd check if all of you were still here.  I'll just go in and join the gang and you two go on.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: There's no gang in there -- We were the last ones.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, I'll go in and have a bite.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Jennifer, you want to have another drink?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hey, I know how to have a burger by myself.  I feel like a little solitude.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Come on, I'll buy you a drink. There's a big thing over at the Italian embassy.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm not sure I'd be good company tonight.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'll be the judge of that.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's much too soon for you to have this kind of buzz around you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Do I have to stand here in the middle and meet them all?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'll get you through.  Move and smile.  And smile and move...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Maybe we could just sit here -- talk a little?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Okay.  You didn't like the party, huh?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Too many smart people in one room -- it's not healthy...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm going to have to do a story from beginning to end on my own.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Eventually.  Does it have to be right now?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Believe me, I wouldn't be doing this unless it was absolutely necessary. I have an idea for something.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I just read about it in a magazine and it affected me.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, what is it?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: If I tell you, can you manage not to put it down or tell me why it won't work or is in bad journalistic taste or anything like that?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yes, Tom -- I think I can manage.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm not sure I dialed right -- Jane?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Jane, yes.  Tom?  Tom, is that you? Is this Tom?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I had to sleep fast so I took two allergy pills to help me...I'm sorry...Hey, you called me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's not important.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Says who?  Not important -- ha-ha-ha. I was dreaming -- Oh, no -- can't tell -- how embarrassing for me. Gosh.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What pills did you take?  You sound more like someone on a general anesthetic.  Maybe I'd better speak to you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Nooo.  Is it your story?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No.  Are you going to the Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Why, you need me for the story?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No.  Were you going to you?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Maybe I'll get off work.  I'd like to go.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Oh, good.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We can go together.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: So you like me, huh?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I like you as much as I can like anyone who thinks I'm an asshole.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: So what did you think?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It moved me.  I did relate to it -- I really did.  It was unusual for you to cut to yourself when you tear up -- and that might not have been my choice...but it's real and it got me...and I think a lot of the time I'm too conservative about that kind of stuff.  Okay?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's incredible who's here.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Me!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Suppose I go in for a little while and you wait in the lobby-bar.  How's that?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Good.  That's it...See you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're not going to take off on me, are you?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Uh-uh.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Why can't I let go of this woman?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: At least kiss me when you do that.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You just can't stop editing me. Huh?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: This is hysterical.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I was half hoping I wouldn't have a good time tonight.  You know why?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Because you're nuts.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Right, right -- Isn't she fun to tease?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I don't remember saying anything like that -- exactly...I don't know why I just did.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Oh let's see -- wait a minute, well, I can think of two reasons.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Three...I just thought of a third... If you talk about it, you don't have to do it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's not it.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Good...Another is you're trying to make it all about sex and heat and nothing else.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I forgot all about Aaron.  I promised to stop by and see how he did.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'd like to know.  I'll go along.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: No.  I'll see you at your apartment as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Don't run off --  like everything's settled the minute you make up your mind.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: He might be weird -- he can talk more freely if I go alone -- why's that so hard to understand?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's not that it's hard.  I just want you to give me a minute to catch up.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Okay.  Sorry.  Don't yell at me like that again, you scared the life out of me.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hi.  It's me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I can't get away just yet.  I'm at Aaron's.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, when?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'm not sure.  It seems like he had sort of a mishap on the news.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I know.  I taped it.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It wasn't as bad as he think, was it? -- it wasn't unprecedented or anything?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Not if you count 'Singing in the Rain.'  Do him a favor and don't treat it like a tragedy.  You want me to talk to him?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hi, again.  Sorry about...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No.  That sounds more important. Let's forget about tonight.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I don't know if that's absolutely necessary.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I've got my father coming through tomorrow anyway.  I should get some sleep.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'll see you at the office.  Good night.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay.  Good night.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Good night??!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Jane, I'm not some chore you have to finish so you can stay on schedule.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Okay, great, Grunick -- Easy shots now -- huh?  Good night.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I feel terrible about what happened. What did he say?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: He -- uh -- said he liked you because you looked like you had -- fire and honesty.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: No.  Did he really?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yes.  Then he said a really weird thing...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That it would be a treat to make someone like you feel better... He gets like that sometimes.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: That's so perfectly...It really makes me feel a little faint...  Whooo.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Maybe I haven't been here long enough.  But, hey, congratulations on the promotion.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: How can you say that to me?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sorry.  I can't stand here feeing bad that I don't feel worse.  This has happened at every station I ever worked for. Look, I think it's crazy for you to come in here tomorrow and start a new job.  I have a week to get to my job.  Let's get the hell away to some island fast and find out how we are together away from this.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, I just think that' an extraordinary proposal.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's yes?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: That's more than 'yes' -- that's 'you bet.'

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Then give me a minute...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You fucking...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I saw the taped outtakes of the interview with the girl.  I know you 'acted' your reaction after the interview.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I felt funny about it afterwards.  It's verboten, huh?  I thought since I did it for real the first time -- but I get you.  That's not the reason you're not coming?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Of course it's the reason.  It's terrible what you did.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We disagree on how God-awful it was.  Why don't you come with me and we can disagree and get a tan at the same time?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Jesus, if you're glib about this I'm going to lose it.  I was up all night and...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Jane, Jane, Jane, Jane, Jane...

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It made me ill.  You could get fired for things like that.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I got promoted for things like that.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Working up tears for a new piece cutaway...You totally crossed the line between...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's hard not to cross it; they keep moving the little sucker, don't they?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It just proves that the difference we have are...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: This is a one-way argument.  We've got six days; if you go and we fight and we hate it -- we'll come home.  If you don't go?  Well, that's a much bigger deal.  I go to London right after that. So, it'd be very big deal if you stay here.  The plane's boarding.  You're good at deadline.  Here's your ticket.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's amazing.  You commit this incredible breach of ethics and you act as if I'm nitpicking.  Try and get this.  When you edited that...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm leaving now.  Gate 43.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: That's not going to be the way we say good-bye.  Even though I think what you did was rotten -- it's not all impersonal.  You mean something to me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You keep coming after me and looking down on me.  It's starting to make me batty.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I don't wan to discuss work.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, let's do a special report on that...I mean that's news.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I knew what you meant.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What I don't know, I can learn and what I know, nobody can teach. Excuse me for saying it about myself, but I think it's true.  What do you think?  Never mind what you think.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You're lucky I came after you so you got that off your...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yes, I am.  Thanks.  I mean it.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: So you have an extra bathing suit, huh?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You want to come?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's just that one of the few things I'm not confused about is what I was saying downstairs, that...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Then you should stay here.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: It's better when you let me say it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Take it easy.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Why did I have to do this to myself?  Watch you take off.  Call me if you need anything.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, why not?  Hey, what is this?  My life's rushing in front of my eyes.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: A picnic?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I thought for ol' Cliff here -- Look at you?  You're more adorable than your pictures.  Look what I got for you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What a great surprise.  I didn't think we had a chance.  I heard you wanted to stay in Washington.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, there's a guy, but he says he'll fly up a lot.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, we should talk.  You going to have time for  dinner?  I'd like you to meet Lila.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'm sorry because I was looking forward to that, but I' m going back in a few hours.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay...It's so good to see you.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: This is very awkward.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Go ahead -- what?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Ummm -- it's dumb dorm stuff but I see Tom around you a lot and this is such a small office and I'd like to see him outside of work, unless there's some reason for you to mind... in which case I just won't do anything.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: God Almighty -- Whew.  Do I mind? Why do I mind?  I do mind.  What a shock -- I don't have a right to... I don't think I like him.  I know I don't respect him...So what am I talking about -- what am I saying to you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're saying stay away from him.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I can't be.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I sure know that feeling.  Terrific work today.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Right back to you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: So he bought this Peugeot sedan at a greatly reduced price while he was there in charge of the White House Advance Team.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How come you're not chasing it down yourself?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Look, I'm junior man -- and it's your beat.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Boy, that's nice...I wish we could all deal with each other like this. I'll check it.  Anything I can do for you?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: This is my first time at the White House. Is there any chance to look at where he works and the rest of it?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I didn't have the guts to ask when I first came up.  I'll get you a great tour.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: The last time I was with someone we went through this awful mutual disease questionnaire but I guess it beats getting paranoid the next day.  Okay, I'll go first.  I haven't...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It would never occur to me to worry at all about you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Where's the bathroom?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Through the closet.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I converted a bedroom -- this stuff builds up.  Wait till you've been doing this sixteen years.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm not knocking it.  It's a great solution.  Not only the storage but you can see everything you have.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's enough.  That's enough.

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Yes, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Don't be silly.  What are you sorry about?

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: The way you were looking at me, I just went.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I just need you for another minute now, so we can shoot from behind towards me, and, um...

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: ...that way we have someplace to go when we cut.  And I just sit here, I nod my head and look nerdy.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Don't you work here?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Not anymore!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Would you like to do me?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I just might.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'd be glad to help.  For $50 an hour.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's not true I am a sculptor!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: If you were an artist you could have created something!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm going home!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I wanted to apologize for being nasty to you this evening.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Listen schmuck, why don't you get out of here and let me go to bed!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't finish talking to you!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well I'm done talking to you, what do I have to do, draw you a diagram!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I decided to make a female figure after all!  I want you to pose for it.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well I'm touched.  You're serious, aren't you?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yes.  Fifty dollars an hour, right?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Tonight.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What, right now?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's kind of dark -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shh!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm almost ready -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sit in this chair, and I'll pose you.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That doesn't look like very much clay.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh it's enough...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Are you nervous, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: N-no...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Not even a little bit?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I already told you I'm not.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: When's the last time you had a totally nude girl in your room...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Um...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Without a stitch of clothing on, sitting and facing you...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: A girl with a body like mine?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're breaking my concentration!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Walter can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Are you a virgin?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's just an innocent question.  Besides I just wanted to clarify your intentions.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Whaddya mean?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Well I just wanted to make sure you know, fully and completely, that you're never gonna get any from me, at least in this lifetime.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Look -  This pose is all wrong!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'll pose any way you want.

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Alright we're clear.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Anything new?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Not really.  One girl who fit the descrip came in, kinda skinny, brunette, didn't see much changing hands.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Is the manager cooperating?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Yeah, he's keeping an eye out, said he'd call us if he sees anything. That's about it for tonight.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Alright I got you, man.  It's my turn for freak patrol.

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: You know it.  I'm out of here.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Everyone wants to meet the bus boy.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: What did he do?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: He made a cat.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: See you later -

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Righto.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Don't worry about him...what have you got?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A thing I made.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I've never seen anything like this, maybe Segal, but nothing with such... dichotomy...  It's very good, Walter -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Honest?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You really like it?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Of course...it's wonderful.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Great!  What is it?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's a...full length life-size figure!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's it called?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Murdered man.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: It's called spontaneity, Leonard. Get with the program.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah it was all just an accident.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Look at the size of it!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's not really that big I got it on kind of a stand...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Let's see it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, well, I'm a little nervous, I never did a person before.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You can do anything you want if you set your mind to it.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Like it?  It's a masterpiece.  I've never seen anything like it before... and I hope I never see anything like it again. Walter smiles and looks at his creation -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: How did you ever find it all in yourself, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It wasn't easy.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Gee..twenty five dollars for something I made!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Now you're a professional!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Hi Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Carla...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: These guys came by to help me try out some of my new organic recipes.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's up, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I came over to see you.  I brought something...I wanted to show you.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.  Can some of you guys help me?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Is it murdered man?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Better!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You think she's better than Murdered Man?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Well I can't say that Walter!  She's incomparable.  They're both great.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: More champagne, your majesty?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Here here...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Where where...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: There there...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: May I please have another little kiss?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter!  Jeez!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sorry...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Did you hear what he said?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Yes Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: All about me...
